name: crumbling
content:
Add to word list

present participle of
crumble
C2 [ I or T ] to break, or cause something to break, into small pieces: She nervously crumbled the bread between her fingers. The cliffs on which the houses are built are starting to crumble.
[ I ] to become weaker in strength or influence: Support for the government is crumbling.
